title: David's Commitment to Righteousness
shortSummary: Psalm 101 is a declaration by King David of his personal commitment to live a life of integrity, justice, and holiness before God. It highlights his resolve to reject wickedness and to promote faithfulness within his household and kingdom, reflecting a heart devoted to God’s standards.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the psalm and king of Israel, expressing his personal vow to live uprightly and govern righteously.

definitions.definition: Perverse or stubbornly disobedient; used here to describe a heart that is morally crooked or rebellious.
A path of moral integrity and completeness, signifying wholehearted obedience to God's commands.
To speak falsely or maliciously about someone, damaging their reputation.
To remove or eliminate, often used in the Bible to describe divine or judicial judgment against the wicked.

outline.heading: David’s Praise and Commitment to Mercy and Judgment
outline.description: David opens the psalm by committing to sing of mercy and judgment, indicating his intention to honor God through both compassion and justice.

outline.heading: Personal Resolve to Walk in Integrity
outline.description: David expresses his determination to live wisely and with a perfect heart, rejecting wickedness and those with perverse hearts from his presence.

outline.heading: Rejection of Slander and Pride
outline.description: David declares he will remove those who secretly slander others and those who are proud, emphasizing the importance of humility and truthfulness.

outline.heading: Promotion of Faithfulness and Righteousness
outline.description: David commits to favoring the faithful and those who walk in integrity, refusing to tolerate deceit and lies within his household.

outline.heading: Judgment Against the Wicked
outline.description: David concludes with a vow to eliminate the wicked from the land, underscoring his role as a righteous leader dedicated to purging evil.

application: Commit daily to walk in integrity and purity, seeking to live before God with a perfect heart.
Reject and avoid relationships or influences that promote wickedness, pride, or slander.
Cultivate faithfulness and honesty in your community, encouraging others to walk in righteousness.
Pray for God’s guidance to discern and remove sinful influences from your life and environment.

keyVerses.text: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals David’s earnest desire for God’s presence and his commitment to live with moral integrity.

keyVerses.text: I will set no wicked thing before mine eyes: I hate the work of them that turn aside; it shall not cleave to me.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the importance of guarding one’s heart and eyes against temptation and sin.

keyVerses.text: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbour, him will I cut off: him that hath an high look and a proud heart will not I suffer.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the seriousness of slander and pride, and the need to oppose such attitudes firmly.

keyVerses.text: I will early destroy all the wicked of the land; that I may cut off all wicked doers from the city of the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: David’s commitment to remove wickedness from the community reflects the biblical call for godly leadership to uphold justice.
